SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE: Darbepoetin alfa is a novel erythropoiesis-stimulating protein developed for treating anemia
In animal models, exogenous recombinant human erythropoietin has been reported to be beneficial in treating experimental cerebral ischemia
In this study, we determined whether darbepoetin alfa would protect in a rat model of transient focal cerebral ischemia
METHODS: Rats received 2-hour middle cerebral artery suture-occlusion
The drug (darbepoetin alfa, 10 microg/kg) or vehicle was administered intraperitoneally 2 hours after onset of middle cerebral artery occlusion
Animals were allowed to survive for 3 or 14 days
Infarct volumes and brain swelling were determined
RESULTS: Darbepoetin alfa-treated rats showed improved neuroscores relative to vehicle-treated animals beginning within 1 hour of treatment and persisting throughout the 14-day survival period

Darbepoetin alfa significantly reduced corrected total (cortical + subcortical) infarct volume (56.3+/-20.6 and 110.8+/-6.8 mm3, respectively) and total infarct areas at multiple levels compared with vehicle in the 14-day survival group
Brain swelling was not affected by treatment
CONCLUSIONS: Darbepoetin alfa confers behavioral and histological neuroprotection after focal ischemia in rats
